meanings.definition: A small metal hook with a loop at one end, used for attaching ropes or cords.
meanings.sent1: I hung the plant from the ceiling using an eyehook.
meanings.sent2: The eyehook on the wall held the painting securely.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to swing from the eyehook, thinking it was a branch.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze was like an eyehook, capturing every detail in the room.
meanings.sent5: The shiny eyehook gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with an eyehook.
meanings.sent1: I will eyehook the curtain tie-backs to keep them in place.
meanings.sent2: She decided to eyehook the leash to the dog's collar before going for a walk.
meanings.sent3: He tried to eyehook his shoelaces together as a prank, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The idea of love eyehooked their hearts together, never to be separated.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye eyehooked onto the smallest clue, solving the mystery.
